result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Chippewa County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. STEVEN J POTTER

records.addlTxt: Fees paid on behalf of Steven Potter. Final notice and invoice mailed to defendant.
Claim for Legal Services filed by David Field.

2:32 PM Defendant STEVEN J POTTER in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for STEVEN J POTTER.  Attorney Sara Matthews in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
22CM61 Ct 2: Defendant enters no contest plea.
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 

22CM61 Ct 1 and 22CM15 entirely DRI

Court orders:
S/W 12 months probation
novp
anger management assessment and follow through
any counseling
$443 - 60 days to pay
DNA

Resolution reached. Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant STEVEN J POTTER in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for STEVEN J POTTER.

Review hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:32 AM Defendant STEVEN J POTTER in court with Attorney David W. Field.  Sheila M. Yohnk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
22CM15 and uncharged matter. Uncharged matter to ride with 22CM15. Both to be Br 3. Bond continued.  Review hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Income Assignment Order for Unpaid Fines and Other Financial Obligations

No contact with victim 1 except electronic (text/email) regading custody or placement issues for children in common.
One time visit to residence allowed to be arranged through CVW to obtain personal belongings.
Child exchanges may be between the parties as long as no contact occurs. 
No verbal or physical abuse of anyone.

01:52 PM Defendant STEVEN J POTTER in court with Attorney David W. Field.  Sara Matthews appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney waives reading of complaint. Defendant is informed of charges. Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint.  Review hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
